greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Primes p such that Ramanujan number tau(p) is divisible by p.
comment: Primes at which cusp form Delta_12 (see A007332) is not ordinary.
reference: J. Roberts, Lure of the Integers, Math. Assoc. America, 1992, p. 275.
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
link: F. Q. Gouvea (1997) Non-ordinary primes: a story, Experimental Mathematics 6(3), 195-205.
N. Lygeros and O. Rozier (2010) A new solution for the equation tau(p)=0 (mod p). Journal of Integer Sequences 13, Article 10.7.4.
N. Lygeros. A new solution for the equation tau(p)=0 mod p. Number Theory mailing list (NMBRTHRY).
mathematica: (* First do *) <<NumberTheory`Ramanujan` (* then *) Select[ Prime[ Range[ 5133]], Mod[ RamanujanTau[ # ], # ] == 0 &] (* _Dean Hickerson_, Jan 03 2003 *)
xref: Cf. A000594, A007332. A proper subset of A063938.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, _Robert G. Wilson v_
ext: a(6)=7758337633 from N. Lygeros and O. Rozier, Mar 16 2010. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Mar 16 2010
